meanings.definition: The width of a hand measured from the tip of the thumb to the tip of the little finger.
meanings.sent1: She measured the fabric using handbreadths to ensure it would fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used handbreadths to determine the size of the collar.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to catch the moving handbreadths of sunlight on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted with precision, capturing the delicate handbreadths of a flower petal.
meanings.sent5: The old map was detailed, showing distances in handbreadths for easy navigation.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measurement equal to the width of a hand.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used handbreadths to mark the length of the wooden plank.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, people used handbreadths to measure cloth for clothing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a few handbreadths of nuts from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed gently, its banks lined with handbreadths of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept of handbreadths by using her own hand as a reference.
